text: The <extra_id_0> Ah receptor <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> recognizes DNA binding sites for the <extra_id_0> B cell transcription factor <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , <extra_id_0> BSAP <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> : a possible mechanism for dioxin - mediated alteration of <extra_id_0> CD19 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> gene expression in human B lymphocytes .
2 , 3 , 7 , 8-tetrachlorodibenzo-p-dioxin ( TCDD ) inhibits murine and human B lymphocyte immunoglobulin production through an unknown mechanism .
This study investigated the effect of TCDD on expression of the <extra_id_0> CD19 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> gene in a human B lymphocyte cell line .
Northern blot analysis showed that TCDD treatment decreased steady state levels of <extra_id_0> CD19 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> mRNA by 67 % in the IM-9 cell line .

Using a gel mobility shift assay , we identified a DNA - binding complex in IM-9 nuclear extracts that by several criteria appears to be the <extra_id_0> Ah receptor <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .

In addition , the <extra_id_0> Ah receptor <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> complex recognized a DNA binding site for <extra_id_0> B cell lineage-specific activator protein <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> BSAP <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) in the promoter region of the human <extra_id_0> CD19 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> gene which is similar to the consensus <extra_id_0> Ah receptor <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> DNA binding site .

These results suggest that the <extra_id_0> AhR <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> could interfere with <extra_id_0> BSAP <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - stimulated <extra_id_0> CD19 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> gene transcription by competition for a common DNA binding site .
